SEARCH
Package org.rancore.math

Class Pi

java.lang.Object
org.rancore.math.Pi
public class Pi extends Object

Class Name:

Pi

Description:

The Pi class provides four methods to approximate the value of Pi using different mathematical techniques.

Instance Variables:

None

Constructor:

None

Methods:

pi(int n): Approximates Pi using the Ramanujan formula, a rapidly converging series with the specified number of terms.

archimedesMethod(int sides): Approximates Pi using the Archimedes Method by calculating the perimeter of an inscribed polygon with the specified number of sides.

leibnizSeries(int terms): Approximates Pi using the Leibniz series, an infinite series with the specified number of terms.

monteCarloMethod(int numPoints): Approximates Pi using the Monte Carlo method by generating random points within a square and calculating the ratio of points inside a unit circle.

ramanujanFormula(int terms): Approximates Pi using the Ramanujan formula, a rapidly converging series with the specified number of terms.

Main Method:

None

It's important to note that the approximations provided by these methods are not exact and may have varying levels of accuracy depending on the input parameters.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • pi

      public static double pi(int method, int n)

      Pi Approximation

      Approximates Pi using the specified method based on the value of 'n'.
      Parameters:
      method - the method selector
      Returns:
      an approximation of Pi using the specified method

    • archimedesMethod

      public static double archimedesMethod(int sides)

      Archimedes Method

      Approximates Pi by calculating the perimeter of a polygon inscribed within a circle. The more sides the polygon has, the closer the approximation to Pi.
      Parameters:
      sides - the number of sides of the inscribed polygon
      Returns:
      an approximation of Pi using the Archimedes Method

    • leibnizSeries

      public static double leibnizSeries(int terms)

      Leibniz Series

      Approximates Pi using the Leibniz series, an infinite series. The more terms added to the series, the closer the approximation to Pi.
      Parameters:
      terms - the number of terms in the Leibniz series
      Returns:
      an approximation of Pi using the Leibniz Series

    • monteCarloMethod

      public static double monteCarloMethod(int numPoints)

      Monte Carlo Method

      Approximates Pi using the Monte Carlo method, which relies on random numbers. By generating random points within a square, the ratio of points inside a unit circle approximates Pi/4.
      Parameters:
      numPoints - the number of random points to generate
      Returns:
      an approximation of Pi using the Monte Carlo Method

    • ramanujanFormula

      public static double ramanujanFormula(int terms)

      Ramanujan Formula

      Approximates Pi using the Ramanujan formula, a rapidly converging formula. The more terms added to the series, the closer the approximation to Pi.
      Parameters:
      terms - the number of terms in the Ramanujan formula
      Returns:
      an approximation of Pi using the Ramanujan Formula
